[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: fee_statement_from_gas_meter()] [Gas manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the gas calculation by causing integer overflow in gas_used computation when max_gas_amount minus balance is computed, potentially leading to incorrect fee charging or free transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: charge_change_set()] [Storage fee bypass] Can an attacker craft transactions with specific write set patterns that cause process_storage_fee_for_all() to undercharge storage fees, allowing cheap state bloat attacks and potential DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: charge_change_set()] [Fee refund manipulation] If storage_deletion_refund feature is enabled, can an attacker exploit the refund calculation to get more refund than they paid, effectively stealing funds from the gas pool? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: gas_used()] [Integer underflow] Does the checked_sub() in gas_used properly handle all edge cases, or can carefully crafted transactions cause the balance to exceed max_gas_amount leading to panic or incorrect gas calculation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: charge_change_set()] [IO gas bypass] Can an attacker create transactions with events or write operations that bypass charge_io_gas_for_event() or charge_io_gas_for_write() checks through race conditions or specific ordering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_signed_transaction()] [Signature bypass] Can an attacker exploit the keyless authenticator validation path to bypass signature checks when is_simulation is true, allowing unauthorized transaction execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_signed_transaction()] [Duplicate signer bypass] Does contains_duplicate_signers() check all signer combinations including fee payer, or can an attacker include the same address in multiple roles to bypass validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_signed_transaction()] [Account abstraction bypass] When account abstraction is enabled, can an attacker craft malformed AuthenticationProof that passes initial validation but fails during dispatchable_authenticate(), leaving the system in inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: dispatchable_authenticate()] [Signer data forgery] Can an attacker manipulate the AbstractAuthenticationData to forge signer data and execute transactions on behalf of other accounts without proper authorization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_signed_transaction()] [Proof count mismatch] If senders.len() != proofs.len(), the validation returns error, but can race conditions during parallel execution cause this check to be bypassed in Block-STM? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: run_prologue_with_payload()] [Sequence number manipulation] Can an attacker exploit the separation between prologue validation and execution to reorder transactions and bypass sequence number checks, enabling replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: success_transaction_cleanup()] [Gas meter inconsistency] In gas_feature_version >= 12, if gas_meter.algebra().check_consistency() fails in success epilogue, the transaction is aborted, but can this be exploited to cause DoS by intentionally triggering inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: failed_transaction_cleanup()] [Error handling bypass] When gas meter consistency check fails in failure epilogue, the system logs but continues - can this lead to incorrect fee charging and economic exploits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: finish_aborted_transaction()] [Account creation exploit] Can an attacker exploit should_create_account_resource() during failure path to create accounts without paying sufficient fees through carefully timed out-of-gas errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: run_prologue_with_payload()] [Empty payload bypass] Can an attacker bypass the empty payload check by manipulating extra_config.is_multisig() flag to execute empty transactions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_and_execute_script()] [Unstable bytecode bypass] Does reject_unstable_bytecode_for_script() properly validate all script metadata, or can attackers deploy unstable code to mainnet through metadata manipulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_and_execute_script()] [Serialized args exploit] When ALLOW_SERIALIZED_SCRIPT_ARGS feature is disabled, can attackers craft TransactionArgument::Serialized that passes validation but causes execution errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_and_execute_entry_function()] [Native entry function bypass] The check for function.is_native() rejects user-defined native entry functions, but can this be bypassed through module metadata manipulation or reflection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: validate_and_execute_entry_function()] [Randomness manipulation] When get_randomness_annotation_for_entry_function() marks session as unbiasable, can attackers exploit timing to bias randomness generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: execute_script_or_entry_function()] [Intrinsic gas bypass] Can charge_intrinsic_gas_for_transaction() be bypassed by crafting transactions with malformed transaction_size() values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: execute_multisig_transaction()] [Payload mismatch exploit] When abort_if_multisig_payload_mismatch is enabled, can attackers exploit the empty payload path to execute unauthorized multisig transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: execute_multisig_transaction()] [Deserialization bypass] Can an attacker craft malformed payload_bytes that pass bcs::from_bytes() but cause execution errors in the inner function, bypassing validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: execute_multisig_entry_function()] [Signer forgery] Can the SerializedSigners constructed with multisig_address be manipulated to impersonate other accounts during entry function execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: failure_multisig_payload_cleanup()] [Cleanup bypass] If the cleanup function fails, does the system properly handle the error, or can this leave multisig accounts in corrupted state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/aptos_vm.rs] [Function: execute_multisig_transaction()] [Gas charging race] Can the timing between payload execution failure and cleanup allow attackers to avoid paying gas for failed multisig transactions? (Low)
